item.description:
Holiday Open House at the Millyard Museum

Saturday, December 1, 2012

FREE Admission - no reservation required

10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.

 

 

Enjoy time spent with your neighbors, family and friends on this special day of shopping and fun family activities in the Millyard Museum.

SCHEDULE 

ALL DAY - 10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.
- Children's Holiday crafts
- Holiday storytelling
- See the "Red Cross - 95 Years in New Hampshire" exhibit - Last day!
- See many other historical exhibits - spanning Manchester's history from the Paleo-Indians to the present.
- Enter raffles to win great prizes!
- Play old-fashioned board games and win free prizes by completing an educational Gallery Hunt.
- Enjoy cookies and cider.
- Shop for the holidays in the Museum Shop, featuring historical books, stocking stuffers, and unique collectible brass ornaments including the new "Amoskeag Steam Locomotive." 
- Members of the Manchester Historic Association receive an extra 10% discount this day only (at least 20% off all shop items).
- Additional sales on select items and special gift membership packages available.

10:00 a.m.-12:30 p.m.
- Meet costumed reenactors - a Revolutionary War soldier playing period music on the fife and an 18th Century lady spinning on an authentic spinning wheel.

10:30 a.m.-11:30 a.m.
- Guided tour of the Millyard Museum

12:00 p.m.-1:00 p.m.

- Meet Max - the mascot of the Manchester Monarchs hockey team!

12:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m.

- DJ Dave Martinez will play holiday music in the Elm Street Gallery, including your special requests. Sponsored by Centrix Bank.
- Visit with Santa Claus and tell him what you want for Christmas this year!
 

Park at the Millyard Museum and walk up to Elm Street to view the Spirit of New Hampshire Christmas Parade which starts at 4:00 p.m.
item.name: Holiday Open House at the Millyard Museum
